intro.description: This tutorial will demonstrate how to define and preview an extension point schema.

item.title: Open the schema file
item.description: Double-click on the "schema/htmlBrowsers.exsd" file to open it.

item.title: Add the "browser" element
item.description: On the "Definition" page of the schema editor, press "New Element" in the "Extension Point Elements" section.

subitem.label: In the "Element Details" section, replace the content of the "Name" field with "browser".
Select the "extension" element and choose "New > Sequence" from its context menu.
From the context menu of the "Sequence" node, choose "New > Reference > browser".
Make sure the 'browser' element reference is selected.
In the "Element Reference Details" section of 'browser', set the "Max Occurrences" to "unbounded"

item.title: Add the "id" attribute
item.description: In the "Extension Point Elements" section, make sure the "browser" element is selected, and press "New Attribute".

subitem.label: In the "Attribute Details" section, replace the content of the "Name" field with "id".
In the "Attribute Details" section, change the value of "Use" from "optional" to "required".
In the "Description" section, input "a unique identifier for the browser."

item.title: Add the "name" attribute
item.description: In the "Extension Point Elements" section, make sure the "browser" element is selected, and press "New Attribute".

subitem.label: In the "Attribute Details" section, replace the content of the "Name" field with "name".
In the "Attribute Details" section, change the value of "Use" from "optional" to "required".
In the "Attribute Details" section, change the value of "Translatable" from "false" to "true".
In the "Description" section, input "a human-readable name for the browser".

item.title: Add the "class" attribute
item.description: In the "Extension Point Elements" section, make sure the "browser" element is selected, and press "New Attribute".

subitem.label: In the "Attribute Details" section, replace the content of the "Name" field with "class".
In the "Attribute Details" section, change the value of "Use" from "optional" to "required".
In the "Attribute Details" section, change the value of "Type" from "string" to "java".
In the "Attribute Details" section, set the value of the "Implements" field to "org.eclipse.browser.view.ui.actions.IHTMLBrowser".
In the "Description" section, input (without the quotes): "This class is invoked to open a given URL. The class must implement org.eclipse.browser.view.ui.actions.IHTMLBrowser."

item.title: Add documentation
item.description: Select the Overview page of the schema editor and perform the following steps in the Documentation section:

subitem.label: Replace the content of the "Description" tab with: "This extension point is used to register different types of browsers that can be used to open the HTML documents in the Eclipse Browser view."
Replace the content of the "Since" tab with: "1.0"

Replace the content of the "Examples" section with: "

The following is an example of the extension point:

"
Replace the content of the "API Information" section with: "Each browser must provide a class that implements the org.eclipse.browser.view.ui.actions.IHTMLBrowser interface."
Replace the content of the "Supplied Documentation" section with "The default implementation is to open the HTML documents with the internal browser.".

item.title: Save the Schema
item.description: Select "File > Save" from the main menu to save the schema.

item.title: Preview the schema
item.description: Right-click anywhere inside the schema editor and choose "Preview Reference Document" from the context menu. This will open transform the schema into an HTML document and open it into an internal browser.
